title: Larry Coryell - I'll Be Over You (1995) RESEED
description:
(feat. Grover Washington, Jr.)
MP3/256kbps

Larry Coryell sings through this set in his most romantic voice: The opening, title track features smooth soulman Peabo Bryson singing in tandem with Sharon Bryant and Grover Washington Jr.&#039;s sweet soprano, and with just Washington in Tonight is the Night. Try a Little Tenderness lights the candlelight mood for Coryell and Chuck Loeb to dance on flamenco guitars, cushioned by soft keyboard whispers, of a piece with Coryell&#039;s instrumental slow dance with The Isley Brothers&#039; "quiet storm" classic For the Love of You. The guitarist sharpens his blues hooks on W.C. Handy&#039;s trademark St. Louis Blues, stabbing chords to counterpoint Harrison&#039;s blues vocal and Dan Haymann&#039;s piano boogie. Redwing features Coryell on both flamenco and electric guitars, as do the trios Before Dawn and Cumulus, mists of flamenco, Mark Sherman&#039;s vibes and keyboards, and Zach Danziger&#039;s floating drums. The concluding duet between Coryell and Loeb on Charles Mingus&#039; Better Get Hit in Your Soul spins together an encyclopedic holy grail of modern guitar accompaniment and improvisation, convening a joyously blue exclamation from their guitarist&#039;s souls to close.

Personnel:
Larry Coryell - Guitar
Peabo Bryson - Vocals
Sharon Bryant, Carmen Cuesta -Vocals (Background)
Tracy Wormworth -Bass
Chuck Loeb - Synthesizer, Keyboards
Zach Danziger - Drums
Donald Harrison - Sax (Soprano), Sax (Tenor), Vocals
Grover Washington, Jr. - Sax (Soprano), Sax (Tenor)

Track Listings:
1. I&#039;ll Be over You
2. Redwing
3. Tonight Is the Night
4. Try a Little Tenderness
5. St. Louis Blues
6. For the Love of You
7. Nightshade
8. This Love of Ours
9. Before Dawn
10. Cumulus
11. Better Get Hit in Yo&#039; Soul
